newsitem.title: USA: U.S. House votes to create commemorative quarter.
newsitem.headline: U.S. House votes to create commemorative quarter.

text.p: The House by voice vote Wednesday passed legislation allowing the secretary of the Treasury to issue five new quarter-dollar coins each year for 10 years, commemorating each of the 50 states.

The measure would allow the Treasury to begin issuing the commemorative quarters in 1997. The quarters will be standard circulating coins, similar to those issued in honor of the U.S. bicentennial in 1976. The Senate has not yet taken up the bill.
